results.title: The Kangaroos
results.creator_credit: David Moore and Peter Du Cane
results.brief_description: An amazingly diverse group of marsupials, the kangaroos range from small hare-wallabies and curious tree dwelling kangaroos in the Queensland rainforests, to the great Red, Euro and Grey Kangaroos of the plains, hills and forests. The behaviour of these and other kangaroos is the subject of this program.

results.title: The Joycelin Shrager story
results.creator_credit: Barton Weiss, Mark Block and Kino Delux
results.brief_description: The filmed biography of Joycelin Shrager, a mythical, appallingly incompetent woman director, whose obsession with film pervades her whole existence.

results.title: The Koala brothers
results.creator_credit: Tobias Fouracre, Famous Flying Films and Spellbound
results.brief_description: Set in outback Australia, two aeroplane-pilot koala brothers set out to help anyone in need. Other Australian animal friends are also involved in their adventures. “The Koala Brothers” is a puppet-style animated television series suitable for children aged 2 to 6 years old. This DVD contains six episodes approximately 10 minutes each. Narrated by Jonathon ‘Jono’ Coleman.

results.title: The Joy of winter
results.creator_credit: Bernard Gosselin, Jean Dansereau, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How Canadians adjust to their long, snowbound season. Filmed with humour, The Joy of Winter shows people making the best of what they cannot change. From tiny tots to human polar bears the film leaves no doubt that, in the eyes of many Canadians, winter may offer more attractions than summer. Film without words. (Awards: Gijon; Necochea.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bernard Gosselin, Jean Dansereau, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Koala
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Vincent O'Donnell, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Prior to the 1920’s the koala was in danger of becoming extinct in Australia because it was unprotected. This film looks at the koala, its biological characteristics and the various types of species which are determined by its climatic region in Eastern Australia. Those features which make the koala particularly adaptable to its territorial environment are described and its life cycle is surveyed. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: The Journey of Natty Gann
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Mike Lobell and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: America is in the depths of the Great Depression. Families are broken apart when far away jobs beckon. A courageous young girl confronts overwhelming odds when she embarks on a cross-country search for her father. During her extraordinary odyssey, she forms a close bond with a magnificent protective wolf, and a hardened drifter. Stars Meredith Salenger, John Cusack, Ray Wise, Laine Kazan.

results.title: The Kiss
results.brief_description: Sue and Bob haven’t had sex in ages, much to the chagrin of Sue (Zoe Carides), but not Bob (Peter Brown), who would rather spend time fixing the car. Bob gets more than he bargained for when his gay, next door neighbour (Hugo Weaving) offers to assist in the car’s repair. (Awards: Winner Best Comedy and Best Score, TropFest Film Festival, 1998)

results.title: The King: Wayne Carey
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Visual Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: There is no more influential or imposing figure in football today than the Kangaroos captain; Wayne Carey. Voted as the greatest player of the twentieth century by Leigh Matthews, Carey has stamped his mark as the dominant centre half forward of his era in over 200 games. All Australian captain, quadruple club champion, leading goalkicker, Carey has earned himself the worthy reputation of “King”. In this program Carey reflects on the memorable moments of his career, there are also revealing interviews with coach Denis Pagan as well as team mates and opponents.

results.title: The Killing of Sister George
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Associates and Aldrich Company and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George”, the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera, and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.
